H0.text: Electrical currents carry the sound of the bell to the student.

H1.text: Magnetic signals are the means by which the sound of a bell reaches the student.

H2.text: Radio waves carry the sound of the bell to the student.

H3.text: Vibrating air carries the sound of the bell to the student.

A4.text: Sound can propagate through a medium such as air, water and solids as longitudinal waves and also as a transverse wave in solids.

A5.text: Sound cannot travel through a vacuum.
